headline.main: Longtime Nebraska Senator Flexes a Second Skill: Sketching
headline.print_headline: Longtime Nebraska Senator Flexes a Second Skill: Sketching

docs.snippet: Nebraska's longest-serving lawmaker drops to one knee and spreads more than five-dozen sheets of notepaper across the floor of his office....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nebraska's longest-serving lawmaker drops to one knee and spreads more than five-dozen sheets of notepaper across the floor of his office.

headline.main: A Look at How Residential Colleges Work at Some Schools
headline.print_headline: A Look at How Residential Colleges Work at Some Schools

docs.snippet: Colleges are confronting the related problems of sexual assault and drinking with a mix of solutions, some aimed at changing an ingrained culture that encourages irresponsible behavior. Dartmouth College appears to be the only school responding by...
docs.lead_paragraph: Colleges are confronting the related problems of sexual assault and drinking with a mix of solutions, some aimed at changing an ingrained culture that encourages irresponsible behavior. Dartmouth College appears to be the only school responding by completely overhauling its housing into a system of "residential colleges" — a concept that goes back centuries in England but exists at only about 30 U.S. schools.

headline.main: Starbucks Ends 'Race Together' Campaign in Stores, Effort Not Over
headline.print_headline: Starbucks Ends 'Race Together' Campaign in Stores, Effort Not Over

docs.snippet: Starbucks Corp head Howard Schultz told employees on Sunday they will no longer be encouraged to write "Race Together" on drinks cups, but the company's effort to promote discussion of racial issues “is far from over”....
docs.lead_paragraph: Starbucks Corp head Howard Schultz told employees on Sunday they will no longer be encouraged to write "Race Together" on drinks cups, but the company's effort to promote discussion of racial issues “is far from over”.

headline.main: Feyenoord Upset Leaders PSV as Ajax Close Gap
headline.print_headline: Feyenoord Upset Leaders PSV as Ajax Close Gap

docs.snippet: Anass Achahbar scored two dream goals for Feyenoord as they beat runaway leaders PSV Eindhoven 2-1 on Sunday to delay their opponents' march to the Dutch league title....
docs.lead_paragraph: Anass Achahbar scored two dream goals for Feyenoord as they beat runaway leaders PSV Eindhoven 2-1 on Sunday to delay their opponents' march to the Dutch league title.

headline.main: 9 British Medical Students Feared to Be in Syria via Turkey
headline.print_headline: 9 British Medical Students Feared to Be in Syria via Turkey

docs.lead_paragraph: A Turkish opposition lawmaker said Sunday he is helping the families of nine British medical students and doctors believed to have crossed into Syria from Turkey.

headline.main: 1st Trial in Girl's Running Death Previews Stepmom's Case
headline.print_headline: 1st Trial in Girl's Running Death Previews Stepmom's Case

docs.snippet: The capital murder trial of an Alabama woman convicted of running her granddaughter to death as punishment provided a window into the case against the girl's stepmother, who is awaiting trial on a murder charge....
docs.lead_paragraph: The capital murder trial of an Alabama woman convicted of running her granddaughter to death as punishment provided a window into the case against the girl's stepmother, who is awaiting trial on a murder charge.

docs.snippet: In a story March 22 about Texas' funding of a veterans education program, The Associated Press misidentified Rufus Coburn's role with the Texas Veterans Commission. Coburn is the director of the commission's education program, not the commission's...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story March 22 about Texas' funding of a veterans education program, The Associated Press misidentified Rufus Coburn's role with the Texas Veterans Commission. Coburn is the director of the commission's education program, not the commission's executive director.

headline.main: Box Office: ‘Insurgent’ Tops With $54 Million,' Gunman’ Flops
headline.print_headline: Box Office: ‘Insurgent’ Tops With $54 Million,' Gunman’ Flops

docs.snippet: “Insurgent” topped the weekend box office with $54 million, but its opening will likely fall just short of the numbers put up a year ago by the first film in the “Divergent” series....
docs.lead_paragraph: “Insurgent” topped the weekend box office with $54 million, but its opening will likely fall just short of the numbers put up a year ago by the first film in the “Divergent” series.

headline.main: Sex Assault, Drinking Push Colleges to Moment of Reckoning
headline.print_headline: Sex Assault, Drinking Push Colleges to Moment of Reckoning

docs.snippet: On college campuses nationwide, the intertwined problems of sexual assault and alcohol are under intense scrutiny as students increasingly speak up and the federal government cracks down. Pushed to a collective moment of reckoning, colleges and un...
docs.lead_paragraph: On college campuses nationwide, the intertwined problems of sexual assault and alcohol are under intense scrutiny as students increasingly speak up and the federal government cracks down. Pushed to a collective moment of reckoning, colleges and universities are trying a slew of solutions focused on education, environment and enforcement.

headline.main: Degenkolb Times It Right to Win Milan-San Remo
headline.print_headline: Degenkolb Times It Right to Win Milan-San Remo

docs.snippet: Germany's John Degenkolb celebrated the biggest triumph of his career after winning the Milan-San Remo one-day race, the first of the season's five "Monument" classics, on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Germany's John Degenkolb celebrated the biggest triumph of his career after winning the Milan-San Remo one-day race, the first of the season's five "Monument" classics, on Sunday.
